meanings.definition: The practice of lending money in exchange for personal property that is held as security.
meanings.sent1: Pawnbroking is a common way for people to get quick cash by using their belongings as collateral.
meanings.sent2: I visited the pawn shop to learn more about pawnbroking and how it works.
meanings.sent3: When the cat tried pawnbroking with its favorite toy mouse, the pawn shop owner had a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: In the game of Monopoly, players engage in a form of pawnbroking when they mortgage their properties for cash.
meanings.sent5: The concept of pawnbroking can be traced back to ancient civilizations where people exchanged goods for temporary loans.

meanings.definition: The act of pawning an item for a loan.
meanings.sent1: After losing his job, he resorted to pawnbroking to borrow money against his watch.
meanings.sent2: She decided to go into pawnbroking to get some extra cash for her upcoming trip.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel went into the pawn shop, attempting pawnbroking with an acorn as collateral.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, pawnbroking can be a lifeline for those facing financial difficulties.
meanings.sent5: The art of pawnbroking requires careful consideration of the value of the item being pawned.
